posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: AdvantageScope is also a great resource.

posts.name: UnofficialForth
posts.cooked: For those not familiar with all the features of AdvantageScope, can you elaborate on this?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FRC Team 4272  Mentor | World's FLL Emcee

posts.custom_user_title: FRC Team 4272  Mentor | World's FLL Emcee

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked:
Itâ€™s a data visualisation software, that you can use to better visualize logged data from your code.

Assuming your codebase is implementing AdvantageKit correctly, you can run your code in the simulator, connect AdvantageScope to the sim, and drive your robot around. You can change camera views, from orbiting the field, orbiting the robot, etc.

You can visualise your swerve modules states, and make sure that your swerve control is correct before ever touching a robot.

Lots of possibilities.

You can also just open up AdvantageScope, create a new 3D field tab, and fly around the field without any robot code.

posts.name: Dan Katzuv
posts.cooked:
viggy96:

Assuming your codebase is implementing AdvantageKit

This is not a requirement, AdvantageScope can show data from WPILOG files not recorded with AdvantageKit, it can also show live data from NetworkTables: AdvantageScope/docs/OPEN-LIVE.md at main Â· Mechanical-Advantage/AdvantageScope Â· GitHub
